identificationModule.briefTitle: Motor Excitability Study of High Definition Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (HD-tDCS) in Chronic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Motor Excitability Study of High Definition Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (HD-tDCS) in Chronic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: High definition tDCS will be conducted to both stroke and healthy subjects on primary motor cortex area to explore the motor excitability changes before and after stimulation. In next stage, a randomized control trial with 20-session training will be conducted to evaluate the effectiveness of transient modulation of cortical excitability through multisite HD-tDCS with EMG driven robot hand training, a sham stimulation with EMG-driven robot hand training will be applied as control group.

armGroups.label: Anode HD-tDCS
armGroups.description: The center anode is fixed on the ipsilesional primary motor cortex and the 4 surrounding cathode electrodes will be placed about 6 cm to the center.

armGroups.label: Cathode HD-tDCS
armGroups.description: The center cathode is fixed on the contralesional primary motor cortex and the 4 surrounding anode electrodes will be placed about 6 cm to the center.

armGroups.label: Sham HD-tDCS
armGroups.description: The center anode is fixed on the ipsilesional primary motor cortex and the 4 surrounding cathode electrodes will be placed about 6 cm to the center.

interventions.name: HD-tDCS
interventions.description: Different stimulation protocols will be applied to the primary motor cortex of stroke patients. After 20-minute stimulation, EMG-driven robot hand training will be conducted.

primaryOutcomes.description: It is used to investigate the changes in corticomuscular coherence for studying connectivity between the brainwave using EEG and the affected hand muscles using EMG. In addition, EMG will be used to detect muscle activation change and muscle co-contraction pattern alteration.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before intervention, During intervention, After intervention, 6-month after intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: The ARAT is a 19-item measure divided into 4 sub-tests (grasp, grip, pinch, and gross arm movement) to assess upper limb functioning
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before intervention, After intervention, 6-month after intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: It is used to evaluate and measure upper-limb recovery in post-stroke hemiplegic patients, and items are scored on a 3-point ordinal scale
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before intervention, After intervention, 6-month after intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: It is used to identify neural correlates of stimulation-induced behavioral gains for investigating tDCS-induced changes in brain activations
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before intervention, After intervention, 6-month after intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: It is used to measure the changes in interhemispheric imbalance and corticospinal excitability
